multiple_choice_question.text: What type of glueballs are represented by the dotted line in Figure 1?
choices: Scalar glueballs with Cauchy boundary conditions
Tensor glueballs with Cauchy boundary conditions
Scalar glueballs with Neumann boundary conditions
Tensor glueballs with Neumann boundary conditions

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of relationship does the data seem to prefer between the mass and mode number of glueballs, as opposed to the quadratic relationship suggested by the graviton model?
In Figure 3, what modification is made to the right-hand plot compared to the left-hand plot?
choices: The right plot uses a different AdS model.
The right plot includes lattice data for charmed glueballs.
The right plot adds a conventional mass term for the tensor component of the graviton.
The right plot shows data from an unquenched lattice calculation.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the formula MÂ² = 4k +8, what does the variable \'k\' represent?
choices: Energy scale of the AdS model
